content.raw:
I'm not familiar with Mac or Homebrew, but I wonder if it could be related to Homebrew's Python changes. It does seem to end with a complaint about Python not being installed:

```
Warning: Some installed formulae are missing dependencies.
You should `brew install` the missing dependencies:
  brew install python xz
```

but I might be misinterpreting that.
content.html:
I'm not familiar with Mac or Homebrew, but I wonder if it could be related to Homebrew's Python changes. It does seem to end with a complaint about Python not being installed:

Warning: Some installed formulae are missing dependencies.
You should `brew install` the missing dependencies:
  brew install python xz

but I might be misinterpreting that.

pull_request.title: Logging Part 5: Record ignition transport topics

pullrequest.title: Logging Part 5: Record ignition transport topics

content.raw:
This function provides the implementation of `Recorder::AddTopic(~)`, so the documentation of that public API function is identical to the documentation of this implementation function.

I've noticed a recurring issue with Gazebo doxygen where the documentation of a function does not get updated after changes are made to the function. I think this issue would be greatly exacerbated if we duplicated the documentation between the public API functions and the internal implementation function. By referencing the public API function documentation instead of copy/pasting it, my hope is to apply the DRY principle to our documentation and minimize issues of documentation falling out of sync.
content.html:
This function provides the implementation of Recorder::AddTopic(~), so the documentation of that public API function is identical to the documentation of this implementation function.

I've noticed a recurring issue with Gazebo doxygen where the documentation of a function does not get updated after changes are made to the function. I think this issue would be greatly exacerbated if we duplicated the documentation between the public API functions and the internal implementation function. By referencing the public API function documentation instead of copy/pasting it, my hope is to apply the DRY principle to our documentation and minimize issues of documentation falling out of sync.

content.raw:
Windows experienced an internal compiler error (ICE), which literally means we ran into a bug in the MSVC compiler.

I've gotten this branch to build, run, and pass tests on my Windows virtual machine, so I'll go ahead and run the Windows build test again. Hopefully the ICE was just a one-off issue that won't resurface.
content.html:
Windows experienced an internal compiler error (ICE), which literally means we ran into a bug in the MSVC compiler.

I've gotten this branch to build, run, and pass tests on my Windows virtual machine, so I'll go ahead and run the Windows build test again. Hopefully the ICE was just a one-off issue that won't resurface.
